pullRequest.title: [Photos Support] Upload photos to firebase storage
pullRequest.bodyText:
Towards #310

Uploads selected photo to firestore storage
If offline, the sdk handles the re-uploading when the network is available
files are uploaded using the UUID. So, they can be stored in the db without actually having to upload the photo first
Adds picasso to load the uploaded photo using Uri (Bug: The bitmap isn't getting loaded into the ImageView, added a TODO for that)

commit.message: Return final destination url instead of local file path
Load photo from firestore and fallback to local storage

nodes.bodyText: Please explain what Picasso is and what it's used for.
Can we instead inject FirebaseStorage or StorageReference to make it mockable in tests?
Please use the util class RxTask.toMaybe() instead.
What's the difference between file and fileName? Please rename to something self explanatory and/or explain in JavaDoc.
Please add JavaDoc describing this method's behavior.

Do I understand correctly that we're currently relying on Firebase to manage offline support?
If so, can we add a TODO and a bug to implement our own offline photos functionality using Android Workers and the local db?

Alternatively, you can recast  this as getRemoteImagePath(filename) and use:
return String.join(File.separator, args.getProjectId(), args.getFormId(), filename);
Refactor splitting filename into its own method, also for consistency with logic for building filename.

commit.message:
Spotbugs: File.separator can't be used in regex
pmd: fix comment

nodes.bodyText: Firestore != Firebase Storage; please rename to something more appropriate, e.g. firebaseStorageReference.

Are we filtering by JPG?
Also, is it possible to upload more than one image for a particular field? If so fieldId alone won't unique.
